record.title: Sugar beet root aphids: identification, biology, & management
record.creator: Wenninger, Erick J.
record.description: Sugar beet root aphids feed on the roots of sugar beet plants throughout major North American sugar beet-growing regions. In severe cases, they may reduce tonnage and sucrose levels by more than 30 percent. Few insecticides are registered against them. This 7-page publication with color illustrations outlines an integrated pest management approach to managing this pest.

record.title: Grass Seeding Forest Roads, Skid Trails, and Landings in the Inland Northwest
record.creator: Brooks, Randy ; McFarland, Ashley ; Schnepf, Chris
record.description: Sediments are one of the main nonpoint sources of pollution for lakes, rivers, and streams in the Inland Northwest. This 8-page publication (including cover) shares strategies for protecting waters by seeding forest roads, skid trails, and landings. Tables specify ideal mixes of plants best suited for overstory, understory, and legumes, so not only is the environment protected, but wildlife and livestock find nourishment.

record.title: Idaho Plant Quarantines and the Home Garden: Understanding the Laws
record.creator: Agenbroad, Ariel; Bell, Susan M.

record.title: Contribution of Agribusiness to Idaho's Economy, 2010
record.creator: Taylor, Garth; Eborn, Ben; Watson, Philip; Rodriguez, Abelardo
record.description: In 2010, Idaho agribusinesses sold more than $15 billion of goods and services, generated $3.4 billion in gross state product, and created 50,000 Idaho jobs. It was Idaho's largest base industry by sales and second-largest base industry by jobs and value added. This publication gives the contributions of agribusiness and other economic sectors to the overall Idaho economy in 2010.

record.description: How to find Idaho food producers who share their crops with subscribers via a program known as Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) is focus of this publication. record.title: Southern Idaho Fertilizer Guide: Beans
record.creator: Moore, Amber; Carey, Anna; Hines, Steve; Brown, Brad
record.description: Providing optimal levels of nutrients is critical for achieving competitive bean seed yields. Also, because of their poor root systems, beans are more prone than other crops to react to micronutrient deficiencies and toxicities. This publication provides fertilizer recommendations for commercial dry and garden beans grown under southern Idaho conditions and are designed to meet the needs of a typical bean field.

record.title: Economic Development Challenges for Small Towns in Idaho's Butte, Custer, and Lemhi Counties
record.creator: Rodriguez, Abelardo; Stringham, Tammy; Cheyney, Charles
record.description: Small towns in Idaho's Butte, Custer, and Lemhi counties face particular challenges because of their rugged remoteness and also because of the area's biggest, most famous employer--the Idaho National Laboratory (INL) near Arco. This publication examines 19 sectors contributing to the three counties' economies, including INL and its contractors. It helps local planners and elected officials understand how to think about INL. While big and important, INL doesn't impact the tri-county economies as much as it would if a greater percentage of INL employees lived in the area instead of commuting from Idaho Falls, etc. How should local leaders respond? This report offers some ideas.
record.subject: economic development;
record.publisher: University of Idaho. Extension

record.title: Center Pivot Irrigation for Corn: Water Management and System Design Considerations in Southern Idaho
record.creator: Hines, Steve; Neibling, Howard
record.description: This bulletin describes the water requirements of the corn crop and explains how to manage a center pivot irrigation system to deliver enough water to the crop at the right times. It focuses on three sources of water stress that can reduce crop yield: water stress at critical crop stages, insufficient water to meet evapotranspiration requirements of the crop, and water stress due to surface runoff of applied water.
record.subject: corn; irrigation systems;

record.title: Portable Test Kits for Diagnosing Potato Diseases
record.creator: Woodell, Lynn; Olsen, Nora; Karasev, Alex; Miller, Jeff; Thornton, Michael K.; Wharton, Phillip; Nolte, Phillip
record.description: University of Idaho scientists evaluated commercially available portable test kits for diagnosing potato diseases, finding them generally accurate and easy to use. This publication discusses the importance of making an initial disease diagnosis in order to pick the correct, disease-specific, test kit and gives step-by-step instructions, accompanied by color photographs, for using three types of test kit.

record.title: Powdery Mildew on Sugarbeet: Importance, Identification, and Control
record.creator: Neher, Oliver T.; Gallian, John J.

record.title: 4-H Home Food Preservation Series: Freezing Project Manual
record.creator: Gillespie, Donna R.; Wittman, Grace; Lanting, Rhea
record.description: For ages 8-18, the freezing project manual covers the basics of healthy eating and food safety and specific instructions for freezing fruits; juices; vegetables; meat, fish, and poultry; and convenience foods such as pizza. Sixteen hands-on activities engage youth in freezing a variety of foods and using frozen foods in recipes, menus, and taste tests. Each activity concludes with questions for further learning. The manual follows USDA food-preservation guidelines. Other manuals in the series deal with drying (ages 8�18), boiling water canning (ages 8�18), and pressure canning (ages 14�18).

record.title: Idaho Master Gardener Program Handbook, 15th ed
record.creator: Prepared by a committee of University of Idaho Extension educators: Tripepi, Robert R.; Bauer, Michael; Bell, Susan M.; Jones, Wayne B.
record.description: Gardeners throughout Idaho use this basic gardening handbook as their text in the increasingly popular Master Gardener classes. The 24 how-to chapters cover everything from soil fertility to insect management. Gardeners use the large three-ring notebook to add specialized and localized information.

record.title: The Role of Agricultural Processing in Idaho’s Economy: Status and Potential
record.creator: Lewin, Paul; Painter, Kathleen; Patterson, Paul E.; Rimbey, Neil R.; Gray, C. Wilson
record.description: Idaho food manufacturing accounts directly for 16,000 Idaho jobs (2% of the total), $8.5 billion in sales (7.3% of the total), and $1.2 billion of Idaho's gross state product (2% of GSP). This publication discusses the economic contributions made by the processing of barley, beef, dairy products, potatoes, sugarbeets, and wheat in Idaho. For each commodity, the publication discusses economic contribution, processing and location, production and price trends, and strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats.

record.title: Anaerobic Digestion Basics
record.creator: Chen, Lide; Neibling, Howard
record.description: Anaerobic digestion offers the dairy and food-processing industries a way to address environmental concerns associated with waste, generate renewable energy, cut bedding-material costs, reduce pathogens and weed seeds associated with manure, and improve manure nutrient availability to plants. record.title: Mineral Supplementation of Beef Cattle in the Pacific Northwest
record.creator: Whitehurst, Billy
record.description: This bulletin will help ranchers to assess the mineral needs of their beef cattle and to start thinking about where to invest money on mineral programs and where to save a few dollars without diminishing animal performance. Topic covered include determining deficiencies, antagonists, mineral interactions, symptoms of deficiency or toxicity for various macro and micro minerals, organic vs. inorganic minerals, and supplementation frequency. Minerals discussed include calcium, phosphorus, magnesium, potassium, sodium, sulfur, iron, selenium iodine, cobalt, molybdenum, copper, zinc, and manganese.
